main event: A ground-visual observation of an elliptical, silver object in Teddington, England on 1st September 1955, lasting 4-5 minutes. The object had a smooth, gradual descent and no erratic movements.
interesting points: The object was observed to have an elliptical shape and appeared silver due to sunlight reflection.
The observer lost sight of the object while driving through a wooded area.
The observer was wearing polaroid sunglasses during the sighting.
Weather conditions during the observation included a clear sky, bright sun, and no clouds with a slight morning haze.
The observation involved a reliable witness, a seamstress from Teddington, and a trustworthy operations NCOIC.
sighted object: An elliptical, silver object with smooth, gradual descent
